title: Fortnite hit the magical 125 million number...does that mean it surpassed leagues peak ?

embed.description: Update, June 13: Fortnite developer Epic Games has updated us on the battle royale's total player count.Epic Games announced in a Fortnite blog post that "in less than a year, Fortnite has grown to 125 million players." body: First and foremost, I'd like to say I lack of having an entire knowledge of all the statistics regarding the peak player count or even the current player count of these 2 game giants, league of legends and fortnite. However, I have seen several arguments and debates in these discussions, I my self am also a hard core league player having peaked d2 100lp and failing my d1 promos 5 times(triggerd reelol) and floating in diamond elo for the past 2 years. I have hated this game, even despised at certain moments, however I have high hopes for season 9 and wanted to clear the air on weather or not fortnite has actually beaten league on peak numbers. My personal opinion on this debate is, league is league, it has its bad moments but its for us hardcore gamers that want something out of a hard /fun game, no other game will change that. Anyone know if leagues records on player count and its peak player base have been surpassed by fortnite ?
